title: Avocado Labs - From DevOps to Gatsby JS

metaTags.title: Avocado Labs - From DevOps to Gatsby JS

description.description: This episode is jam packed with knowledge, we will first be taking a look at the DevOps culture which will be explained to us in a simple way by the one and only Diana Rodriguez. Then, the amazing Obinna Ekwuno will show us how we can build our first web app with Gatsby JS!

heroDescription.heroDescription: Avocado Labs is a way to keep people connected online and have access to quality talks. There will be live talks, which will then be uploaded, where expert speakers can share their knowledge. After each talk there will be a 5min Q&A where our speakers will be able to answer any related questions you may have. These episodes will be hosted and moderated by our Auth0 developer advocates to ensure a safe and friendly environment.

childMarkdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: Avocado Labs is a way to keep people connected online and have access to quality talks. There will be live talks, which will then be uploaded, where expert speakers can share their knowledge. After each talk there will be a 5min Q&A where our speakers will be able to answer any related questions you may have. These episodes will be hosted and moderated by our Auth0 developer advocates to ensure a safe and friendly environment.

This episode is jam packed with knowledge, we will first be taking a look at the DevOps culture which will be explained to us in a simple way by the one and only Diana Rodriguez. Then, the amazing Obinna Ekwuno will show us how we can build our first web app with Gatsby JS!

description.description: In this talk we will look at a simple Gatsby JS web app and how we can query data in this application from a headless CMS like SanityIO

intro.intro: Obinna Ekwuno is a Software Engineer with a passion for teaching currently working at Gatsby, he is also a Cloudinary Media Developer Expert and writes about a lot of exciting stuff on Scotch.io and logRocket some of which include topics around JavaScript, Jamstack and the MERN stack. He is mostly nerding out about web accessibility and web performance.
